results.title: The Hurdle
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Dennis O'Rourke and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Douglas Sam, Australia’s best middleweight boxer, had to overcome enormous psychological pressures at the Commonwealth Games of 1982 in Brisbane. Douglas is an Aborigine and many of his people felt that he should not compete in these games. He did compete and the news media made Douglas a favourite for a gold medal. This film traces his wins and his losses.

results.title: The Huntsman
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of a short story by Toronto writer David Lewis Stein about a ten-year-old boy who ferrets out golf balls from the rough, then sells his findings to passing golfers. There is an unexpected development when two unscrupulous older boys try to muscle in on his business. A children’s film, but one that many adults will enjoy.

results.title: The Hunters
results.creator_credit: Film Study Center of the Peabody museum of Harvard University and John Marshall
results.brief_description: A study of the life and culture of four indigenous African bushmen as they hunt a giraffe and other game in the Kalahari Desert. Shows the difficulties of survival in a desert region and the skills displayed by the bushmen. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Hunter (D)
results.brief_description: Set in the farming district of the Coolah Valley, New South Wales, this short fictional film is an indictment of the senseless and indiscriminate shooting of kangaroos, purportedly for sport or recreational value, which sometimes takes place out in the Australian bush. With John Shellabear. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES.

results.title: The Hunt for Red October
results.creator_credit: Mace Neufeld, Paramount Pictures and John McTiernan
results.brief_description: Red October is a technologically superior Soviet nuclear submarine under the command of Captain Marko Ramius (Sean Connery). It is heading for the United States coastline and has the American government in panic mode who presume that the submarine is preparing for attack. Only one man is prepared to consider the possibility that there is another motive. CIA analyst Jack Ryan (Alec Baldwin starring in the role that later featured Harrison Ford) has a different idea; he thinks Ramius is defecting from the Russian navy and it’s a race to see whether Ryan can prove his case before the Russians catch up with Red October and the wayward Ramius. Based on the novel by Tom Clancy. Cast includes James Earl Jones, Sam Neill, Scott Glen and Joss Ackland.

results.title: The Hungry miles
results.creator_credit: Norma Disher, Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit., Keith Gow and Jerome Levy
results.brief_description: A passionate survey of the struggles and achievements of the Waterside Workers Federation including some striking scenes of the depression (reconstructed by the WWF Film Unit with amateur actors), showing the impact of the economic hardships of the 1930s on the union and its members.

results.title: The Hunger machine. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Ian McFarlane and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Feeding the hungry of the world is not just an exercise in good agricultural practices or a result of foreign aid and trade. Governments can affect farmers by imposing tarrifs or providing subsidies so that even in times of surplus, the needy may be disadvantaged. More productive agricultural programmes can increase food supply, however in developing countries who receive aid and food, the incentive to develop these practices may not be encouraged by the political forces in power.

results.title: The Hunger
results.brief_description: The Hunger seamlessly melds gothic horror with a chic, contemporary edge in this erotic tale of sex, blood and desire. The icily beautiful vampire Miriam (Catherine Deneuve) and her latest consort, John (David Bowie), spend their nights scanning the hottest nightclubs in New York for new prey. When John suddenly begins to age at an alarming rate, they seek out Sarah Roberts (Susan Sarandon), a doctor researching links between blood disease and ageing. Disbelieving at first, Sarah rapidly becomes enmeshed in the nightmarish reality of Miriam’s world. Based upon the novel of the same name by best-selling author Whitley Strieber.
